Definition in file N_Timer.h.

Function Documentation

void N_Timer_Start32 ( int32_t  timeoutMs,
N_Timer_t *  pTimer 
)

Start a timer.

Parameters:
timeoutMsThe timer interval in milliseconds.
pTimerThe timer to start.

It is possible to supply a small negative delay. The timer will expire immediately in this case.

void N_Timer_Start16 ( uint16_t  timeoutMs,
N_Timer_t *  pTimer 
)

Cheaper to use version of N_Timer_Start32 for small delays.

void N_Timer_Stop ( N_Timer_t *  pTimer)

Stop a timer.

Parameters:
pTimerThe timer to stop.
Note:
The event will not be triggered, even if the timer was already expired.
bool N_Timer_IsRunning ( N_Timer_t *  pTimer)

Check if the timer is running.

Parameters:
pTimerThe timer to check.
Returns:
TRUE if the timer is running, FALSE otherwise

Note that this function returns FALSE if the timer has expired, but the event has not been handled yet.

int32_t N_Timer_GetRemaining ( N_Timer_t *  pTimer)

Return the remaining time until the timer expires.

Parameters:
pTimerThe timer to check.
Returns:
The remaining time in milliseconds. Even if the timer is not running.
uint32_t N_Timer_GetSystemTime ( void  )

Get the system time.

Returns:
The system time (number of milliseconds since reset).
bool N_Timer_Expire ( N_Task_Id_t  task,
N_Task_Event_t  evt 
)

Helper function to expire a timer (stop the running timer and set the event).

Parameters:
taskThe timer task
evtThe timer event
Returns:
TRUE if the timer was running, FALSE otherwise

Only available if N_TIMER_ENABLE_EXPIRE is defined. It should only be used in unit tests.
